thread.section_title: News24, South Africa's premier news source, provides breaking news on national, world, Africa, sport, entertainment, technology & more.
thread.title: March against graft

author: news24.com
title: March against graft
text:
Pietermaritzburg - Civil society groups have pushed for the Unite Against Corruption march to go ahead tomorrow despite uncertainties surrounding the campaign.
By the time of going to print, National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa (Numsa) in the province, had said they are still waiting on eThekwini municipality to grant them permission for the Durban leg of the march.
However, Right to Know (R2K) KwaZulu-Natal (KZN) insisted that there will be a march from King Dinu­zulu Park to the Durban City Hall tomorrow.
“We are definitely marching,” said R2K KZN organiser Joanne Adams.
